title: [K-12] Peer-Learning-Based Electromyography (EMG) Training Program for Neurology Residents

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of neurology and clinical diagnostic experience
context.additional_context: Operated as a peer-learning structure where senior participants mentor juniors, integrating practical exercises with digital tools

learning_goals: Learners can diagnose neuromuscular disorders with 80% accuracy through EMG test result interpretation
Through PBL team activities, learners design at least five EMG protocols for actual clinical cases
Tutors apply peer teaching methods to develop EMG educational materials at least three times and incorporate feedback
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
